Question
========

Of a number of children, age was determined in months, and height in centimeters. The data are plotted in the attached scatterplot. Suppose another child is measured, aged 28 months, with a height of 74.6 cm. In this sample, this child is:

![](uva-scatterplot-1256-en-graph01.png)

Answerlist
----------

* An outlier in terms of age and height
* An outlier in terms of age but not in terms of height
* An outlier in terms of height but not in terms of age
* No outlier in terms of age and length, but in the combination of both
* No outlier in terms of age and height, nor in the combination of the two

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* An outlier in terms of age and height: Incorrect
* An outlier in terms of age but not in terms of height: Incorrect
* An outlier in terms of height but not in terms of age: Incorrect
* No outlier in terms of age and height, but in the combination of both: Correct
* No outlier in terms of age and height, and not in the combination of both: Incorrect
